page.title: 01FEATURES OF ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: Eskdalemuir,the largest parish in Dumfriesshire,lies in the north eastern corner of the county, and covers the upper part of the river Esk. Remote and isolated,this one time stronghold of the cheviot sheep is now one of the most heavily afforested parishes in Scotland,approximately three quarters of the land cover consisting of conifers. Seven or eight substancial farms do exist however, several having been farmed by the same family for three generation. Eskdalemuir possesses interesting and unusual features an Observatory run by the British Geological Survey,a seismological station,the Black Esk Reservoir,a Tibetan Buddhist centre and a Wildlife Conservation centre run by the Economic Forestry Group.
